answers.answer: Diabetes Type I and Diabetes Type II are diseases.  When you have Type I diabetes your pancreas no longer produces insulin.  The only way to maintain good health is to inject insulin, carefully monitor blood sugar, and eat a healthy balanced diet.  Type II Diabetes is different because the body still produces insulin, but has a harder time using it efficiently.  Type II Diabetics usually maintain their illness with food plans and exercise.  Some Type II take pills and sometimes have to take insulin injections as well.I have read nothing about Brewers Yeast and am always extremely leery of things that say they can lower blood sugar.  A well balanced food plan and regular exercise are two of the best things you can do for maintaining good health and lower blood sugar.

question: I  have come to  know  that  Brewer,s Yeast  has higher compensatory value  for diabetic weakness. In some countries Brewer,s Yeast is  not sold in medicinal shops. I have also read that BEER can be substituted for yeast for exploiting minerals. so i  want to  know  what is its substitutuin parameter in  case it is a truth.THANKS
title: Diabetic control  thrugh food
